00023 #ifdef _WIN32

00026 
00027 #include <GisCommon.h>
00028 /// \brief
00029 /// The GisIEnvelope class is a three-dimensional, axis-aligned box.  This is a
00030 /// helper type for Geometries, and does not itself inherit from
00031 /// IGeometry.
00032 /// This type is typically used to record the "extents" of a shape, also
00033 /// known in 2 dimensions as an MBR ("Minimum Bounding Rectangle").
00034 /// The box may be initially empty, meaning that no dimensions have an
00035 /// assigned value.
00036 /// each individual extent may be unassigned, in which case using its
00037 /// accessor will return numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN().
00038 class GisIEnvelope : public GisIDisposable
00039 {
00040 public:
00041 
00042     /// \brief
00043     /// Gets the minimum X coordinate value.
00044     /// 
00045     /// \remarks
00046     /// This is the smallest X ordinate value for the envelope, regardless
00047     /// of the sense of the axes.  In a conventional right-handed system,
00048     /// this would be the X coordinate for the point in the rear, lower-left
00049     /// corner of the envelope.
00050     /// 
00051     /// \return
00052     /// Returns the miniumum X ordinate; numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() by default
00053     /// 
00054     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetMinX() const = 0;
00055 
00056     /// \brief
00057     /// Gets the minimum Y coordinate value.
00058     /// 
00059     /// \remarks
00060     /// This is the smallest Y ordinate value for the envelope, regardless
00061     /// of the sense of the axes.  In a conventional right-handed system,
00062     /// this would be the Y coordinate for the point in the rear, lower-left
00063     /// corner of the envelope.
00064     /// 
00065     /// \return
00066     /// Returns the miniumum Y ordinate; numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() by default
00067     /// 
00068     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetMinY() const = 0;
00069 
00070     /// \brief
00071     /// Gets the minimum Z coordinate value.
00072     /// 
00073     /// \remarks
00074     /// This is the smallest Z ordinate value for the envelope, regardless
00075     /// of the sense of the axes.  In a conventional right-handed system,
00076     /// this would be the Z coordinate for the point in the rear, lower-left
00077     /// corner of the envelope.
00078     /// 
00079     /// \return
00080     /// Returns the miniumum Z ordinate; numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() by default
00081     /// 
00082     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetMinZ() const = 0;
00083 
00084     /// \brief
00085     /// Gets the maximum X coordinate value.
00086     /// 
00087     /// \remarks
00088     /// This is the largest X ordinate value for the envelope, regardless
00089     /// of the sense of the axes.  In a conventional right-handed system,
00090     /// this would be the X coordinate for the point in the front, upper-right
00091     /// corner of the envelope.
00092     /// 
00093     /// \return
00094     /// Returns the maxiumum X ordinate; numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() by default
00095     /// 
00096     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetMaxX() const = 0;
00097 
00098     /// \brief
00099     /// Gets the maximum Y coordinate value.
00100     /// 
00101     /// \remarks
00102     /// This is the largest Y ordinate value for the envelope, regardless
00103     /// of the sense of the axes.  In a conventional right-handed system,
00104     /// this would be the Y coordinate for the point in the front, upper-right
00105     /// corner of the envelope.
00106     /// 
00107     /// \return
00108     /// Returns the maxiumum Y ordinate; numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() by default
00109     /// 
00110     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetMaxY() const = 0;
00111 
00112     /// \brief
00113     /// Gets the maximum Z coordinate value.
00114     /// 
00115     /// \remarks
00116     /// This is the largest Z ordinate value for the envelope, regardless
00117     /// of the sense of the axes.  In a conventional right-handed system,
00118     /// this would be the Z coordinate for the point in the front, upper-right
00119     /// corner of the envelope.
00120     /// 
00121     /// \return
00122     /// Returns the maxiumum Z ordinate; numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN() by default
00123     /// 
00124     GISGEOM_API virtual double GetMaxZ() const = 0;
00125 
00126     /// \brief
00127     /// Gets the ordinates as an array.
00128     /// 
00129     /// \remarks
00130     /// The caller must not free the returned array.
00131     /// The ordinates are in the order XYZXYZ, with only those present 
00132     /// according to the dimensionality.
00133     /// 
00134     /// \return
00135     /// Returns the ordinates
00136     /// 
00137     GISGEOM_API virtual const double * GetOrdinates() = 0;
00138 
00139     /// \brief
00140     /// Indicates whether the envelope's extents are set.
00141     /// 
00142     /// \return
00143     /// Returns 'true' if none of the X, Y and Z extents have been set; 'false' otherwise
00144     /// 
00145     GISGEOM_API virtual bool GetIsEmpty() const = 0;
00146 
00147 protected:
00148 
00149     /// \brief
00150     /// Constructs a default instance.
00151     /// 
00152     /// \return
00153     /// Returns nothing
00154     /// 
00155     GISGEOM_API GisIEnvelope() {};
00156 
00157     /// \brief
00158     /// Default destructor.
00159     /// 
00160     /// \return
00161     /// Returns nothing
00162     /// 
00163     GISGEOM_API virtual ~GisIEnvelope() {};
00164 
00165 };
00166 #endif
